questions.question: How do I fix iPhone speaker sound?
questions.answer: Open Clear Wave and run the speaker fix water ejection. Calibrated frequencies push out trapped water and debris. Repeat 2–3 times, then test volume with the stereo test.

questions.question: Does speaker fix work on all devices?
questions.answer: Clear Wave speaker fix works on iPhone and iPad. It requires iOS 15.1 or later and provides the best results on Apple hardware.

questions.question: How long does a speaker fix take?
questions.answer: Most speaker fixes take 10–30 seconds per cycle. If sound is still muffled, repeat the water ejection 2–3 times and check both channels with the stereo test.

questions.question: What if my speaker fix doesn't work immediately?
questions.answer: Repeat the process. Try different frequencies with the tone generator. If distortion persists, it may indicate a blown speaker that needs professional repair.

questions.question: Is the speaker fix app free to use?
questions.answer: Clear Wave is free to download with core speaker fix and water ejection. Advanced audio tools like the pro tone generator are available via in‑app purchase.

questions.question: Can this help with a blown speaker?
questions.answer: If your speaker is blown, the app can diagnose issues (channel tests, distortion checks) and sometimes improve performance by clearing debris or water. Severe damage requires repair or replacement.
